result.execSummary:
The defendant James A Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO COUNTS TWO, THREE AND CASE 13CM004585:  Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments and costs.  To be paid through collection of sums by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge INcarceration Program and the Substance Abuse program after serving the first two (2) years of these sentences.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count three, consecutive to any other time being served.  Credit for 100 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment or fulltime school and part time employment.

No drug dealing or association with drug community, drug users/dealers or drug houses.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with victims Tytiana D., Raidah H., Jade P. or Family Dollar Stores located at 2214 N. 35 Street and 930 N. 27 Street.
No contact with coactor Justin Sumlin 14CF885.

Take any prescription medication only in the manner/dosage as presribed by a treating physician.
Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Participate in cognitive thinking program.
Pay all supervision fees.
Obtain AODA assessment and if necessary successfully complete follow up treatment.  Cooperate with random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.  
Firearms and voting restrictions reiterated by the Court.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two, consecutive to any other time being served. Credit for 100 days.
Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments and costs. To be paid from 25% of funds  as ordered/stated in count two.

Copy of order dated 10/27/20 mailed to defendant at OCI

THE COURT ORDERS:
The Petition for Sentence Adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
-  The defendant was given an opportunity of early release to extended supervision due to his completion of the Substance Abuse Program, and he failed to conform his conduct. In fact, he was convicted of felony fleeing in 19CF3513 and sentenced to consecutive imprisonment. To add insult to injury, the defendant's institutional conduct has been abysmal. During his prior confinement, he was cited with more than 15 conduct violations. During the current period of reconfinement, he has received two conduct reports, including a major violation. All of these factors militate against the extraordinary remedy of a sentence adjustment and demonstrate that the full duration of reconfinement time is necessary to accomplish the goals of punishment, deterrence and community protection. 

-  signed by the Court (electronically)
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, calendar successor, for review. mag
Count two. (James Boyd #620706, Oakhill Correctional Institution, P.O. Box 938, Oregon, WI  53575).
